item.title: Agents and the Work-to-Signal Ratio
item.description:
Agents and the Work-to-Signal Ratio

Think about the last time you researched something for work. Not the moment you understood it. The hours before that moment. The Googling. The opening of fourteen tabs. The copying of relevant paragraphs into a document. The reformatting. The rewriting so it sounded like you and not like a Wikipedia article. The making of a chart because someone on the team “needs to see the visual.” The uploading, the linking, the publishing.

item.title: The Grind Is Ending Faster Than You Think
item.description: Microsoft’s AI chief says 18 months. Capgemini is betting €700 million. UC enrollment is shifting. The signals are converging.
